did.unittitle: Edwin B. Bronner papers regarding Friends World Committee for Consultation

bioghist.p: The Friends World Committee for Consultation (FWCC) is a section of the international Quaker organization which seeks to strengthen spiritual life of the Society of Friends and review its involvement in world affairs. Edwin Bronner (1920-2005) served as chair of Friends World Committee, American Section, from 1967-1971 and chair of Friends World Committee for Consultation from 1974-79. He was also Librarian of Haverford College and Curator of the Haverford Quaker Collection.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of correspondence, minutes, memos, and reports on the activities of committees of the Friends World Committee for Consultation. Topics include: hiring of Association and General Secretaries; planning for the 14th Triennial meeting of the FWCC; the Mission for Service in Guatemala; information on the One Percent More Program; and activities in India, South Africa, and Korea.
